artist: Takehara Shunchōsai; Niwa Tokei (double pages 8, 9, 10 etc.); Text by Akisato Ritō
creditline: Gift of Captain G. B. Powell, Jr., JAGC, USA
description: soft-bound book with light blue cover; white label with black text on cover; some text pages; images include aerial map-like views of landscapes and buildings, ceremonies and gatherings at temples, picnickers watching a dancer, visitors to a shrine with children playing tug-of-war, one page with images of differently shaped shells followed by a page with a drawing of the decoration on a teabowl's interior and exterior (musicians and dancers on interior; chrysanthemums and clouds on exterior), figures with umbrellas on a windy day, people viewing cherry blossoms, people viewing caged birds
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink on paper
text: Devoted to Higashinari County 東生郡. Niwa Tokei designed the double pages 8, 9, 10, 14, 17, 21a, 24, 26, 28, 31, 36, 43, 45, 49, 52b, 53, 57)
title: Pictorial Guide to Famous Sights in Settsu, vol. 2
